website_summaries.verdict: While not a heavy-duty bench vise for professional use, it is still a good choice for hobbyists and weekend warriors. Versatility is its strongest selling point. Decent price point for a light to medium duty bench vise.
pros: Three interchangeable jaw sets and a 180-degree swivel base improve versatility
Solid cast iron construction with anvil and/or additional workspace
Head also swivels 360 degrees for even more adjustability
cons: Hollow casting, not a solid piece of iron
Smaller in size than many users expected

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the cost, not a toy a real tool.
customer_reviews.text: Much more robust then I expected for this price. This will make an great general purpose household vice.Where it says hammer tough I do believe that to be true. Made of very heavy Iron/steel a little tough to open and close at first, gets easier after a few tries. I can see using this vice for many years and for many jobs. Only reason I gave 4 and not 5 is because 5 stars means perfection to me and few things reach that. Good working tool that fits into my tool box. Jaws are 2-3/4' wide, opens to 2-1/2', base clamp opens to slightly wider then 1 3/4' so would mount to standard 2' lumber.
customer_reviews.author: jim whitaker

customer_reviews.title: works great on my small bench top drill press that its ...
customer_reviews.text: Cheap, works great on my small bench top drill press that its intended for. Don't think about it, get this small one and then use some wood spacers to keep your work with no mar. It's not meant for precise work, just to hold stuff down. If you want precision tools, you'll need to spent way more for them like KURT stuff that I use for my milling machine.
customer_reviews.author: JBaz

customer_reviews.title: Terrible amount of slop, super thin casting, look for something better
customer_reviews.text: Lots of slop, as in almost 1/4" - across 2.25" -that's pathetic. The casting is very thin, looking from the underside, it's a hollow cast. Clamping plate rides on thin sheet metal guide. Not even worth fixing, or shimming to get it to "nominal" working tolerances for basic woodworking, much less any metal work.
customer_reviews.author: Victor

customer_reviews.title: Good size vice for the everyday handyman
customer_reviews.text: I needed a vice for projects around the house. I got this based on other reviews, and have not been disappointed. It's sturdy, smooth operating, and has a nice anvil area to work on. The one thing I'd mention is that it comes slathered in grease, so if your not careful it gets on everything. Im not a professional here, so take my opinion with a grain of salt, but I know general quality and have been happy. Overall, i recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: maswell

customer_reviews.title: Great Vise
customer_reviews.text: I received this vise, and I have been extremely happy so far. It attaches with three bolts (not included) and it is very heavy duty, and seems to be very strong. I have used it to hold my heavier chain saws while I sharpened them, and for a few smaller projects, and it has met my expectations completely. It has quite a large sliding mechanism, and the jaws open much wider than prior vises that I have had. I did have to clean it with WD40 to get the slightly sticky packing grease off, but after a fresh coat of lubrication oil, it works smoothly.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Mitchell

customer_reviews.title: Don't Bother
customer_reviews.text: Based on the other reviews, I was not expecting a surgically precise tool, but this thing is simply horrible. The alignment of the sliding jaw to the vice body is so poor that it can't be adjusted properly. Either it will only open 1⁄2 - 2⁄3 of it's total travel, or it's so loose that it doesn't hold well. There were burrs to be filed off, and the set screw that holds the sliding jaw to the adjustment screw is so loose that it needs constant adjusting.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Bad casting beware sharp edges
customer_reviews.text: Good vice for my 8" drill press. Before you use it beware of sharp edges!!!! The casting was very poor and there were numerous sharp edges the worst was inside the jaws. If I would not have noticed it it would have cut into what ever was placed in it. I used the grinder to smooth out these and it seems to work fine. The 4" from Harbor Freight for $17 is better but too big for my press.
customer_reviews.author: Beth H

customer_reviews.title: Badic little clamp that works just fine.
customer_reviews.text: It's your basic bench clamp which is just fine. I bought this along with the 8" WEN drill press. The one minor con of it is that it does not come with any mounting bolts. Wether you place it on a work bench or press you'll have to use your own hardware, I went to my local big box store and purchased a couple of dollar bin clamps that work just fine.
customer_reviews.author: andie w

customer_reviews.title: Great for pressing in roll pins.
customer_reviews.text: I love this little vise. I don't use it for a drill press, but to help hold things that I need to work on. It also works great to push in roll pins, just start em with a punch, push them with this vise most of the way, and then finish tapping them in with the punch. I put 2 layers of electrical tape on the jaws.
customer_reviews.author: Jake

customer_reviews.title: It works if you don't have to have it held perfectly
customer_reviews.text: It's dirty it's well-made Rush doesn't affect it it's Loosely made it does its job if you don't need for affection 14 South Africa price that's what Google Talk set you don't need the Precision because you can tell by the slice again Google said slice when I said price twice and it came out
customer_reviews.author: Frenchie

customer_reviews.title: Meh, it's okay.
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't fit the"wen" brand drill press that's often paired with ("people also bought...") Will work, but not very good tolerances to work with.
customer_reviews.author: T

customer_reviews.title: Cheap but works
customer_reviews.text: It is a very basic, cheap, drill press vise. To compare this to a vise that costs many times more would be unfair. At this price point you get what you pay for. It will hold small objects in place for a drilling operation. I use it with a mini drill press (8") and it is suitable for my needs.
customer_reviews.author: John W. Reeder

customer_reviews.title: the screws that allow the vice to swivel had fallen out and I replaced them with better bolts. The vice looks like a blem
customer_reviews.text: Big pile of junk, casting of this vice is flawed all over, the handle was bent when I received it, I had to rethread screws on the jaws, the screws that allow the vice to swivel had fallen out and I replaced them with better bolts. The vice looks like a blem. I would never buy this brand again. I"ve done so much work on this vice now that it is useable so I'm not going to return it.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Reeves

customer_reviews.title: NOT a heavy duty vise as advertised!
customer_reviews.text: Cast jaw broke under normal operation. Vise was discounted by Amazon as having minor scratches. Wilmar used this loophole to say the vise was used and therefore would not stand behind their warranty. Wilmar also told me there were NO REPLACEMENT PARTS! Look elsewhere for a quality vise. Amazon did make it good.
customer_reviews.author: S and J McArthur

customer_reviews.title: Vise is okay quality and has some metal overflow on ...
customer_reviews.text: Vise is okay quality and has some metal overflow on the guide rails. However, given the price I paid, I didn't expect a Mercedes Benz. Three of the four bolt hold down holes line up with the holes on my Wen 10 inch drill press table.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: Good enough
customer_reviews.text: There was a guy that said it doesn't go out to exactly 2.5 inches. He is right, (see picture) make sure what you're working on is 2", this barely goes over it. Other than that, it has a good grip and is sturdy enough for the price. I recommend if you have anything longer than about a foot and a half and you're going to put it on long side facing up, you might want to get a bigger vise. The clamp is only about an inch and a half.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Vise works well with bench mounted Drill Press.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the 2 1/2 inch Drill Press Vise to use with my new acquired bench mounted Drill Press. Works well, but it is difficult to move around to the proper position using simple bolt/nut attachment. I need to find better attaching fasteners. I love the drill press vice, and would recommend the purchase to others. Good quality and rugged. Remember, it is a small vise, so don't expect to secure large jobs with this vise.
customer_reviews.author: Bob@Kaylahaus

customer_reviews.title: Six in one, half dozen in the other
customer_reviews.text: Liked the price. Not put together that well. Loose screws and loose clamps, idk if it is fixable. So far works alright but would spend more if doing over.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron

customer_reviews.title: Bad product
customer_reviews.text: Bought this product because it fits the 5 speed drill press. got it in the mail today the product looks in enough shape. it sticks when I'm trying to loosen the Jaws on the vice. This drill press Vise is not high quality. Look somewhere else not worth your money.
customer_reviews.author: RAYMOND A HARRELL

customer_reviews.title: Worth it
customer_reviews.text: Inexpensive vise for my inexpensive drill press. Works well for light hobby projects. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: GMc

customer_reviews.title: I'm sure it would have worked fine but quality was not quite as pictured
customer_reviews.text: I returned this vise after receiving it because it was too small for my needs. I'm sure it works just fine for most small projects. Three stars because the photo shows a higher-quality piece than what I received: rough casting and less robust-looking slot flanges.
customer_reviews.author: jkobi

customer_reviews.title: Cheap vice
customer_reviews.text: I did not expect much from this vice, all I needed was a cheap unit to hold things together. If you need something of quality or precision, this vice will disappoint.
customer_reviews.author: Rabbit

customer_reviews.title: What I liked about it it was cheap
customer_reviews.text: What I liked about it it was cheap. What I didn't like was the quality but I guess you get what you pay for I just thought it would be a little better. I wasn't looking for a machinist vise just a little disappointe.
customer_reviews.author: Mike M

customer_reviews.title: No grip, bad casting.
customer_reviews.text: There is absolutely no grip to the vice... completely powder coated where it clamps and doesn't hold much. Also when first clamping it to my tool chest, the entire cast broke in half. It's in the trash now.
customer_reviews.author: paul schnack

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: I diddnt think it would be as small as it was, but that was my fault amd doesnt deserve a low rating for my mistake, other then that it was built sturdy and the clamp wasnt loose. Just make sure its what u need and it wont fail you.
customer_reviews.author: Revelez

customer_reviews.title: Don't let the price fool you.  This is a rugged, well built vice.
customer_reviews.text: For the price, I wasn't expecting much, but this is really a good, heavy duty vice that pairs up beautifully with my Wen 8" 5 speed drill press.
customer_reviews.author: Rob-n-TX

customer_reviews.title: Works for what I need
customer_reviews.text: It fits my 8" WEN well. I think this is a Harbor Freight vise though so I'm not sure how long it will hold up.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Bowen

customer_reviews.title: This vise helps you get a grip in pressing times.
customer_reviews.text: Mine has nice smooth adjustment. This, or one like it, is indispensable with any drill press. Lock down small objects between the jaws or rest cylindrical objects on top of the jaws.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Bowersox

customer_reviews.title: Wilmar W3939 2-1/2drill Press Vise (New)
customer_reviews.text: I use the vise with a Dremel work station drill press and it works fine. A larger vise would be too large for the drill press base.
customer_reviews.author: H Perry

customer_reviews.title: Striped out
customer_reviews.text: My husband used the wood vise for cedar spindles for deck railing. It strip out after one hour of using it . Very disappointed with the vise.
customer_reviews.author: DONNA C FLANNERY

customer_reviews.title: Perfect.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect! Edges are sharp as many noticed which was fixed at no time with file and sandpaper. Price is really right. I wish they include butterfly nuts and bolts to attach to the drill press.
customer_reviews.author: Dmitriy

customer_reviews.title: Price was right. It was what I needed, ...
customer_reviews.text: Price was right. It was what I needed, a little large for my table top drill press but will work.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I love this vice my wife bought me it is perfect ...
customer_reviews.text: I love this vice my wife bought me it is perfect for my table top drill press and mini milling table.i would buy another one in a heart beat but this one will probely last a life time.
customer_reviews.author: Sherriegennis

customer_reviews.title: Cheep but it works.
customer_reviews.text: I needed it to get a grip on things. It is sought of a ruff casting and made poorly but it works for supporting small items.
customer_reviews.author: Michael H. Zemering

customer_reviews.title: Good vice
customer_reviews.text: This little vice is worth it's weight in gold. I use it for craft work, and have used it on the big drill press to drill strap iron. It's plenty tight enough for what I do.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry W. Rapp

customer_reviews.title: Cheap and flimsy
customer_reviews.text: Very cheaply made. fit and finish is not good either. I recommend buying A better quality product
customer_reviews.author: Russell Montgomery

customer_reviews.title: nice little vise.
customer_reviews.text: No dislikes just nice little piece. Great tool for what it's made for
customer_reviews.author: Ron

customer_reviews.title: Good product.
customer_reviews.text: Works well for the money. It was difficult to secure with or on my bench mounted drill press but it can be done.
customer_reviews.author: w. clarke

customer_reviews.title: Works good for good price
customer_reviews.text: Good little vise. Only use it for appropriately sized jobs. Downside is it is not black like the picture but a yellow color. But you could paint it
customer_reviews.author: TonyTheTechnician

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised but probably would fit a little better in a 5 inch jaw
customer_reviews.text: Works as advertised but probably would fit a little better in a 5 inch jaw. I'm using it for gun work and not to hold barrels as I have a better soft grip just for barrels. Clamp it a little tighter than you think you should have to and your good to go.
customer_reviews.author: Douglas W Sharp

customer_reviews.title: Does the trick...
customer_reviews.text: As other reviewers have reported, these work well to gently hold objects in a vise. I purchased them to hold some short wooden dowels in my drill press vise while I drilled them lengthwise...nothing fancy, but they worked well.
customer_reviews.author: WB Halper

customer_reviews.title: Functional good Price, great for Drill Press
customer_reviews.text: Nothing special but for the price it is very functional an will handle most anything place on my drill press.
customer_reviews.author: DavidTop Contributor: Woodworking

customer_reviews.title: Not so great
customer_reviews.text: Kind of shotty and very loose. Not a typical hence vice.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: Bigger than I thought
customer_reviews.text: These are fantastic, but a heads-up to future buyers: The holes you see on the edges for fastening this are HUGE. Think massive lug nut huge. I needed to secure some shelf fasteners to it (long story, DYI project) and needed a combination of washers/spacers/really long screws to secure it. That said, once secure, this thing is built like a truck!
customer_reviews.author: sichinumi

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and Low-Cost Vise
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy and low cost vise. I attached two of them to a portable workbench I take anywhere.
customer_reviews.author: Terry W. Moore

customer_reviews.title: press vice good
customer_reviews.text: very easy to use and holds my pieces in real solid and stable
customer_reviews.author: Jnewman22

customer_reviews.title: Not good for certain applications
customer_reviews.text: Did not fit the (WEN 4208 8 in. 5-Speed Drill Press)
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Horrible
customer_reviews.text: This cane in a box that looked good on outside. The inside box looked like it was hit by a train, and pices of the vice are missing. How do you even do that? Very dissatisfied with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Pat

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I returned this because of too small size for my use.
customer_reviews.author: Lopaka Kanaka

customer_reviews.title: nice and heavy, loose screw
customer_reviews.text: I like it. I took one star away because the screw thread is loose fitting. In fact the whole thing is kind of loose fitting. I use it to hold circuit cards while I solder on them.
customer_reviews.author: D. Riley

customer_reviews.title: It works?
customer_reviews.text: It works but isn't the best for use with the WEN 4208 8 inch
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Pieces loose in the box. Looks like it is used.
customer_reviews.text: Picked the package up and could hear something rattling around inside the package. Opened it up and the set screw had fallen out. The vise looked like it had been used a lot. Tolerances are sloppy.
customer_reviews.author: John W.

customer_reviews.title: Very good product for the price
customer_reviews.text: For the price is great. Not for very heavy jobs. But it works great fir small jobs.
customer_reviews.author: YAS

customer_reviews.title: Functional but seemed used
customer_reviews.text: Product was functional but packaging made it seem like it was a used and returned product. The box was already opened and falling apart with a trashed box tab stuffed inside.
customer_reviews.author: gtaylor.z

customer_reviews.title: Skip the small ones
customer_reviews.text: This broke, cracked, the first time my husband tried to use it. Stick to the hefty ones. He makes rings and went for portable access. It was a waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: WickedLadyT

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for this Price
customer_reviews.text: As expected. Not bad at all for the price. It's very sturdy and will do the job. It's not as precise as a more expensive vice, but at this price is perfect.
customer_reviews.author: James B. Ross

customer_reviews.title: It does the job...
customer_reviews.text: Very nice vice, Needed a little clean up of a burr on bottom. Also smoothed the end of the set screw for better operation. For the price is a good buy.
customer_reviews.author: Cheap Buyer

customer_reviews.title: Not for precision
customer_reviews.text: Burrs cover the edges of the jaws and it was not cleaned or flattened well
customer_reviews.author: Sandy F. Shepard

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Not real high quality, but for my needs it will work. Doesn't fit the Wen press platform.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Vandivier

customer_reviews.title: Vise is perfect for small jobs
customer_reviews.text: Vise is perfect for small jobs. Holds secure and can be fastened to drill press plate for stability and ease of use. Shopping and shipping were fast. Would recommend vise and seller.
customer_reviews.author: Okie

customer_reviews.title: ... for small metal items where a metal vise is useful for cutting
customer_reviews.text: I what I need for small metal items where a metal vise is useful for cutting, sanding, and holding items tight. Great affordable price and very useful item.
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin Ernesto Esconbar Leon

customer_reviews.title: Suits my needs well
customer_reviews.text: Great for holding small items such as rings to engrave
customer_reviews.author: Austin & Rachel

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I use this often and have no had any problems. I guess that what everyone is looking for
customer_reviews.author: C. Foreman

customer_reviews.title: A must have for a small drill press.
customer_reviews.text: I love this vise. It's the only one I could find to work well and fit the platform in my small drill press.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price
customer_reviews.text: You're getting what you pay for with this vise. I use quarter-inch plywood on either side of my work piece to avoid the inevitable marring this vise will do.
customer_reviews.author: DaBare

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Like it a lot.Despite some machining artifacts this tool is a good item for it's price. Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: Borys Shinkaretsky

customer_reviews.title: Unusable
customer_reviews.text: They didn't bother actually riveting the rivet that holds the handle to the screw. The handle and rivet were loose in the package.
customer_reviews.author: GP

customer_reviews.title: good quality
customer_reviews.text: works good on my bench press. Seems to be sturdy. Same as harbor freight
customer_reviews.author: Joey

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality
customer_reviews.text: Well made and very sturdy. Was present for husband and he was very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: ckloss

customer_reviews.title: good but not perfect
customer_reviews.text: definitely worth 15 us dlrs with that being said there was a .032 difference from the right and left side of the vise for most purposes this would be OK but i have access to a mill at work and fixed the issue sorry for no before pictures
customer_reviews.author: Spire

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: GREAT ITEM AT A GREAT PRICE. WORKS GREAT ON MY DRILL PRESS. THANKS
customer_reviews.author: WHYTHIS

customer_reviews.title: These fit perform well... My vise is ...
customer_reviews.text: These fit perform well...My vise is a bit smaller than these jaw pads are but still work flawlessly....You can't beat them for the price and performance.
customer_reviews.author: unklgreg

customer_reviews.title: Really Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: TEKTON 6-Inch Swivel Bench Vise | 54006 - works perfectly and is awesome!
customer_reviews.author: botics

customer_reviews.title: ar15 80% lower
customer_reviews.text: used this for an AR lower build with the easy jig from 80% arms. fit in great and did its job.
customer_reviews.author: Roman Avila

customer_reviews.title: Build quality appears good and it offers good mounting versatility
customer_reviews.text: Works as expected with my drill press. Build quality appears good and it offers good mounting versatility.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn E.

customer_reviews.title: Great addition to my husbands large tool collection.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my husband. He uses it all the time. He gives it 5 stars!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: They work as expected
customer_reviews.text: They work as expected, good polymer material which should hold up to repeated clamping. But, the magnet could be a little stronger.

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Not bad for the price but doesn't do up evenly and is tight.
customer_reviews.author: mark carter

customer_reviews.title: Needs finnishing
customer_reviews.text: This is an unfinished tool that requires some attention to make work properly.

customer_reviews.title: Pos
customer_reviews.text: This thing broke the first time I used it the metal is a very low quality, I was amazed the jaw broke off like it was plastic well tightening by hand

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: my husband loves this in his wood shop good product at a good price fast delivery

customer_reviews.title: i’d recommend spending a bit more on a higher quality vice
customer_reviews.text: Jaws loose, not parallel, front jaw wobbles side to side, i’d recommend spending a bit more on a higher quality vice

customer_reviews.title: Or more like heavy duty
customer_reviews.text: Wished it would have been a little bit bigger! Or more like heavy duty. .. However it luckily did the job for what i needed and its a good price on it
customer_reviews.author: C. Cri

customer_reviews.title: Vice
customer_reviews.text: A little larger than needed for my Dremel drill press. But it works.
customer_reviews.author: William C. Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Mini vise.
customer_reviews.text: This vise is perfect for my mini mill and for the price cannot be beat.

customer_reviews.title: UGLY
customer_reviews.text: A really crude piece of work. NOT for anything needing precsion.

customer_reviews.title: Very small.
customer_reviews.text: Very small. You can tighten vice once it's mounted unless you mount it to a piece of wood or something to get it up
customer_reviews.author: Prostreet

customer_reviews.title: Nice size and price.
customer_reviews.text: From first looks, I will have to spend some time redesigning the metal piece that holds the jaw down. It is flimsy and the screws work loose and if you tighten the screws tightly then you can't adjust the jaw (design issue). Would be better if it had "v" notches in the vise jaws for round work. I will make it better and useful. The price is right for a small vise.
customer_reviews.author: Roger S

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: APPEARS TO HAVE ATTEMPTED REPAIRS--BUT WORKS, WOULDN'T RETURN BECAUSE OF IT.

customer_reviews.title: No, I won't buy another one.
customer_reviews.text: It's been rarely used and still came on my drill press the other day. Below Harbor Freight quality.

customer_reviews.text: Gets the job done. Doesn't come with any mounting bolts so be prepared to provide your own

customer_reviews.text: It was a little small but worked for my purpose ok.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Fit great on the 8" Wen drill press I have.
customer_reviews.author: William G. Pursell, Sr.

customer_reviews.title: A solid light duty vise, great for a hobbiest.
customer_reviews.text: This is a good little piece of equipment for any hobbiest. It is not clunky or cheap, but it is also not a workhorse. I use it for small metal projects on a small drill press. Great for the price

customer_reviews.title: OK.  Sloppily made, but it works.
customer_reviews.text: This is a small, crude, and sloppily made vice, but it's low priced and will do the job.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Strong, level, and adaptable. Pre assembled and ready to go out of the box.

customer_reviews.text: Had to machine my jaws parallel because of a 1/8 taper between the 2 jaws

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: NOT made of cast iron as advertised. some non magnetic zinc type pot metal...returning.

customer_reviews.title: Good Clamp/Vise.
customer_reviews.text: Good vise for holding work to drill or weld. Made of cast iron and machined well.

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: Works just like it should, Zero issues so far. Glad I got it!

product_meta.title: Performance Tool MV10 Hammer Tough 5-Inch Heavy-Duty Multi-Jaw Rotating Combination Pipe and Bench Vise with 360-Degree Swivel Base and Head
product_meta.description:
Size:5" 360° Rotating Head Multi-Purpose ViseHeavy duty cast iron construction. Dual lock downs for easy positioning. Replaceable hardened steel jaws. Diamond serrated for a secure grip.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
Wilmar Performance Tool is an importer with nearly forty years of experience supplying high quality products with great value. You can be confident that the Wilmar Performance Tool products you purchase will perform to the highest standards. The MV10 is a heavy duty bench vice with five inch jaws which open to 4-1/2-inch. The vice has a unique head that rotates 360 Degree so it is very versatile. The vice includes a built in anvil with precision machined surface for the flat shaping of metals. Dual lock downs and 180 Degree swivel base allows easy positioning. Diamond serrated hardened steel jaws for a secure grip. Heavy duty cast iron construction.
feature_bullets: Diamond serrated jaws for secure grip and dual lock downs for easy positioning
Multi-jaw bench vise with swivel base and head to provide clamping action for heavy-duty applications
Replaceable hardened steel jaws. Precision machined surface for flat shaping.
Vise head rotates 360 degrees with locking positions to provide access to the three jaw sets and adjust them for proper placemen
